subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
; “elder brother”
: This sense is attested in Medieval Chinese, and became popular during the Tang dynasty, gradually displacing {{ltc-l|兄}}.
: It is a {{clipping|zh|nocap=1}} of {{ltc-l|阿哥}}, a borrowing from {{bor|zh|und-xbi|*aqa||[[elder brother]]}} ({{zh-ref|Mei, 2015}}). Compare {{cog|xgn-pro|*aka}}, whence also {{cog|mn|ᠠᠬ᠎ᠠ||elder brother}}. Related to {{ltc-l|阿干}}, which is the definite form of the same Xianbei word ({{zh-ref|Mei, 2015}}).
